page.title: 02Landscape
page.content: A fine view of the landscape of this area can be gained from the footpaths east of Cranfield in the vicinity of Marston Thrift or from Wood End, Cranfield which are located on the ridge of boulder clay which runs north - south through the area.The land falls away to the flat - bottomed Oxford Clay Vale through which the A421 runs between Bedford and the M1 via Marston Moretaine.Bedford and the chimneys at Stewartby brick works are clearly visible down the vale.The clay pits are the dominant feature in the vale, originally dug to serve the now defunct Ridgmont brickworks and currently being filled with domestic waste.Some poplar trees are evident, planted as screening for the pits along the roadside.A full restoration scheme has been approved which includes landscaping proposals.
